para: RemoveSegments is a , used as the modifier argument of the command when editing &skel; boundaries. It removes a set of &sgmts; from the boundary specified in the boundary argument of the Modify command. The boundary must be an edge boundary.

The group parameter specifies which &sgmts; are to be removed from the boundary. It must be either the name of a &sgmt; group or the special object, selection, referring to the currently selected &skel; &sgmts;. If the given group or selection contains &sgmts; that are not actually in the boundary, those &sgmts; will be ignored.

Edge boundaries must be constructed from a single contiguous non-branching set of &sgmts;. It is an error to remove &sgmts; from a boundary if doing so would split the boundary into two or more pieces.

caption.para: The left image shows an existing boundary (in orange) and some selected &sgmts; (in green). The right image shows the result of removing the &sgmts; from the boundary. The &sgmt; on the left edge wasn't in the boundary and was ignored.
The selected &sgmt; in green cannot be removed from the boundary in orange, because the resulting boundary would not be connected.
